subject: Re: Fw: Monthly Care Plan Report for https://www.parktrek.com.au - (info@parktrek.com.au)
preview: Afternoon Charles + Bailey,    As promised, please find our recommendations for enhancing the walks page template here. The proposal includes a strategic breakdown of each component and the rationale

full_threads.body:
Afternoon Charles + Bailey,

As promised, please find our recommendations for enhancing the walks page template here. The proposal includes a strategic breakdown of each component and the rationale behind our suggested improvements.

We analysed your traffic sources and found a critical insight - 73% of your current traffic lands on the Home Page, while 27% enters via specific Walk Pages. This means the vast majority of your visitors already know who Park Trek is - but we are currently missing out on the "Discovery" traffic - people searching for destinations (e.g., "Cradle Mountain walking tour") who haven't chosen a company yet.

The proposed design uses a "conversion-first" layout specifically designed to flip this ratio. Our goal is to make these pages rank higher and capture that missing percent of the market. You can view the new design here.

Implementation Details:

  • Timeline: Approximately 1-2 weeks to execute.

  • Focus: SEO visibility (Ranking for destinations) + Conversion (Turning visitors into leads).



Please let me know if you have any questions or would like to go ahead.

Thanks,


Ava Webster

Project Manager



☎ 1300 072 134

✉ ava@wolfiq.com.au
replying here + I informed Ava as well: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/3197825824/185823?viewId=8718913

Hi Charles,

No worries at all - congratulations on the award! I'll get support@wolfiq.com.au to add the logo and they'll confirm when done.

Thanks for clarifying re the NT walks, I'll make sure this is relayed to the team too.

Thanks,


Ava Webster

Project Manager



☎ 1300 072 134

✉ ava@wolfiq.com.au

Thanks for the update Ava, that's reassuring.

Park Trek SEO strategy looks sensible - only one observation is that for the Northern Territory our only focus is Larapinta and Kakadu-Litchfield-Arnhem walks.

Otherwise look forward to hearing thoughts on product pages.

Could I also ask one small favour - on our home page are you able to add our recent Ecotourism Winner logo - it sits well with the tripadvisor and google trust badges. The logo is attached - whichever format looks best.

Thanks
Charles

Afternoon Charles & Bailey,

Just wanted to touch base on a few points you raised last week.

Semush Items
We've reviewed the screenshot provided, and the key points to note are:

  1. No Broken Links: There are zero 404 errors. The site is technically healthy.

  2. Standard Noise: Most 'issues' shown are just standard redirects (e.g., HTTP to HTTPS), which are actually good for SEO.

  3. Semrush Flags: These are automated warnings that appear on almost every site; they aren't 'broken' elements.


We'll run our own Semrush report too and see if any of these items can be tidied for you.

SEO One-Page Plan
Please find our SEO plan here: Park Trek SEO Strategy | One Page Plan including a breakdown of where the site was when you came to WolfIQ, where the site is now that the website is launched, and where we're hoping to take the site in the future.

Moving forward, our monthly SEO reports are shared during the 2nd week of each month. We'll also reach out during the month with any suggestions and approval to implement optimisations.

Product Page Enhancements
I'm still speaking with our team and putting together a mockup of our recommendations to implement, I will be in touch as soon as this is ready.

Let me know if you have any questions!

Have a great evening.



Ava Webster

Project Manager



☎ 1300 072 134

✉ ava@wolfiq.com.au

Hi Bailey,

No problem at all, happy to help! 😊

If anything else comes up or you’d like us to double-check anything, just let us know.

Hi Allie,

That makes sense, thanks for the clarification!

Best,

Bailey Hoadley | General Manager

Hi Bailey,

Thanks for sending that screenshot through!

The screenshot you referenced reflects the status on December 31, 2025, and what you are seeing is the site’s security firewall (BlogVault) acting in real-time.

Here is how the dynamic blocking works:
  • It Changes Day-to-Day: The firewall does not have a static list of blocked bots. Instead, it monitors traffic constantly. If a specific bot (like GPTBot, BingBot, or PublicBot) hits the site too aggressively on a specific day, the firewall puts it in a temporary "time-out" to protect server resources so it won't go down.
  • Temporary: The "Block" in the report was a temporary measure triggered specifically on Dec 31.

In short, the report captured a specific moment when the firewall was active, but it is not a permanent setting that prevents AI tools from seeing your site long-term.

We will keep an eye on these firewall logs to ensure it doesn't become too aggressive, but rest assured the site is accessible with GPTBot

Let me know if that helps clear things up!

Hi Allie,

Thanks for looking into this!

We raised this issue from the report Ava sent through, page 13 says the following:



Please let us know why that snippet says blocked but on your end, it seems to show GPTBot is not blocked.

Thanks!

Best,

Bailey Hoadley | General Manager

Hi Charles,

Thank you so much for your question.

Regarding point 1, we’ve checked ParkTrek.com.au on our end and can confirm that GPTBot is not currently blocked.

To help us investigate further, could you please send through a screenshot of what you’re seeing on your side? If applicable, you may also try triggering a recrawl and let us know if the issue persists.

Once we have that, we’ll be happy to take a closer look.

Thanks again, and please let us know if there’s anything else we can assist with.

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

full_threads.body:
Hi Charles,

Thanks for reaching out - looping in @Wolf IQ Support who will be able to answer point 1.

Fantastic news that you'd like to go ahead with an SEO program - we're confident we can continue to achieve great results. I'll have a chat with the team and we'll put together a One Page Plan with quick wins and key statistics we'll be looking to further move the needle on.

We'd also be happy to take a look at the product pages and put together some recommendations for you, I'll be in touch.

Regarding the mobile speed, absolutely - as of Jan 6, the page speed has increased to 99 on desktop which is fantastic, and 63 on mobile which is a good improvement, but our team will continue working on increasing it further.



Finally, it doesn't look like anything attached from Semrush, if you can send that through we can certainly take a look.

Thanks very much, let me know if there's anything else I can answer for you.

Ava Webster

Project Manager





☎ 1300 072 134

✉ ava@wolfiq.com.au



On Thu, Jan 8, 2026 at 10:01 AM Charles Thompson <charles@parktrek.com.au> wrote:
Hi Ava,

Thanks for your recent monthly report. Couple of things Bailey and I are keen to understand:

1. The GPTBot that was blocked is that one we would actually want to crawl our site to drive AI search? We note that some of the other bots have access.

2. When we first talked with you a key focus was our poor speed score. I note it is still around 54. What can we do to improve this as I think we talked about trying to get in to the 70s given the importance of speed to search engine rankings?

3. As you know we have a Semrush subscription and we get monthly and weekly tips from them - attached is our latest report. Can you help us to fix up these issues and improve site performance.

4. Regarding the SEO proposal. I would like to proceed - when could you start and what KPIs would we have to measure outcomes.

5. Finally, we are currently reviewing our product pages to make them more user friendly and engaging. Given their importance we'd be interested to know if you have any suggestions to drive better engagement and conversion. I should however say the redesign is more evolution that revolution given our websites design / structure constraints.

Thanks
Charles

From: Bailey Hoadley <Bailey@parktrek.com.au>
Sent: Tuesday, January 06, 2026 2:29 PM
To: Charles Thompson <charles@parktrek.com.au>
Subject: FW: Monthly Care Plan Report for https://www.parktrek.com.au - (info@parktrek.com.au)

Hey Charles,

I assume you've received this as well.

I'm on page 13 about Bot Protection and note GPTBot was blocked, I wonder why? I assume that's a Chat GPT thing which I assume we would want on our site as the other search engine ones were allowed.

Otherwise I would just ask them what their plan is to continuously improve the speed score.

Best,

Bailey Hoadley | General Manager
